resources.string: Sevillanas is an Andalusian folk song and dance (3/4 or 6/8 measure, 4 verses) very popular at fairs and pilgrimages, with flamenco influences.
The Bulería is the fastest, happiest, and most festive flamenco style (12-beat measure), originating in Jerez, and is the dance typically used to finish flamenco parties.

The Fandango is one of the oldest flamenco styles, with a ternary rhythm (3/4) that can be solemn or festive, and there are many geographical variants like the Fandangos de Huelva or the Fandango Abandolao.
